editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.note: Five originally independent volumes or fragments, together by an indeterminate date before s. xvii.

supportDesc.extent: 204 leaves (ii + 202) Five originally independent volumes or fragments, together by an indeterminate date before s. xvii. The edges retrimmed and stained red. fol. 179, the first leaf of V, is dirty and was clearly without a binding for a long time.
supportDesc.collation: A singleton, 112(12 canc.) / 2–812, 98(8 canc.) / 10–118, 1212 / 13–1612 / 17–1812. The quires of III are numbered iiii-vi, those of IV are lettered, beginning with e. All were numbered at the beginning, s. xvii.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, sewn on five bands; formerly chained from the usual position. fol. 198 was a pastedown in an earlier binding. fol. i was the rear pastedown, or else the front pastedown in reverse position to the present, in a binding sewn on four bands. It has traces of a brass chain-staple on a piece of parchment pasted to the verso, near the top of the foredge, and possible traces of straps at head and tail, two more at the foredge. fol. 198 has the mark of a central strap or clasp, corresponding to a mark on fol. 1 (there is no corresponding mark on fol. i). Near the foot of fol. 1 are rust-marks of irregular pattern, perhaps from the large iron chain-staple. fol. ii is a paper binding leaf, s. xvii.

history.provenance: On fol. i, upside down: ‘Hunc librum M. Willelmus Reed habuit ex accomodacione magistri Willelmi Lynham in quaternis pro quibusdam libellis quos dictus M. W. Lynham habuit ex accomodacione M. W. Reed predicto’; ‘Liber domus scolarium Mertone Oxon’ ex assignacione magistrorum Willelmi Lynham et Willelmi Reed episcopi Cicestrensis quondam sociorum domus eiusdem. Oretis igitur pro utroque.’ For William Reed, fellow from 1344 until at least 1357, d. 1385, see MS 8. William Lynham (BRUO 1193) was fellow in 1330, until 1349, d. by July 1361. But it is not certain that these inscriptions apply to this book, since fol. i shows signs of having belonged elsewhere.
An erased cautio at the foot of fol. 11v: ‘Caucio magistri Iohannis de Gl[ ... die ... festum / anno Domini M CCCC XXX VIII ...]’. I at least was distributed in the electio of 1519 (UO63. 3).
At the head of fol. 1 is the James no. ‘109’ (wrongly, for that is MS 145), s. xvii in.
On fol. iiv is a table of contents and ‘O. 3. 12. Art:’, s. xvii.
Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with contents, s. xvii, and ‘O. 3. 12. Art:’ again, canc. and replaced with ‘M. 1. 2 (CXL)’ in red; the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, pp. 60–1; Powicke, no. 529; Römer 2. 307; Dondaine & Shooner, no. 140; P. R. Robinson, ‘The “Booklet”: A Self-Contained Unit in Composite Manuscripts’, in Codicologica 3, ed. A. Gruys and J. P. Gumbert (Leiden, 1980), pp. 46–9, and pl. 4.

msItem.title: A flattened bifolium from another book
msItem.incipit: (A section beg.) Circa diffinicionem coloris quam ponit philosophus est innuendum quod color non habet esse

layoutDesc.layout: Bound in sideways, written in 2 cols, with loss of text from the head and much of the outer cols: written space more than 185 × c. 160 mm.; more than long 46 lines.

handDesc.handNote: A debased English rotunda gothic bookhand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Space for a coloured initial; a rubric and red highlighting.

msItem.author: Ps.-ARISTOTLE
msItem.title: Liber de Causis
msItem.explicit: sub tempore eius ens et generatio simul
msItem.incipit: (comm.) Cum ergo remouet causa secunda utilis uirtutem suam a re
msItem.explicit: non adquisitum sicut ostendimus. Conpletus est noster ordo &c.
msItem.note: ed. A. Pattin in Tijdschrift voor Filosofie 28 (1966), 90–203, text from 134.
msItem.bibl: eTK 0335L (‘commentary’). The ‘commentary’, variously ascribed in the MSS, is in fact a set of demonstrations added by the compiler of the main text; Pattin integrates the two.

msItem.author: NICHOLAS OF AMIENS
msItem.title: Ars Fidei Catholicae
Potentia est uis
msItem.incipit: Clemens papa cuius rem uocationis et uite subiecti
msItem.explicit: apparebit hominibus iudicandis homo iudex. Explicit.
msItem.note: Ars Fidei Catholicae and Potentia est uis, as one work.
Ed. M. Dreyer, BGPTM, Neue Folge 37 (1993), pp. 76–120, this copy at p. 52; the Ars only Glorieux, Théol. 107a; Bloomfield 0831. For other copies of the two works as one, see Dreyer, pp. 58–62.

msItem.author: Ps.-AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: De Spiritu et Anima
msItem.incipit: Quoniam dictum est mihi ut meipsum cognoscam
msItem.explicit: (c. 33) est alium non sic quam racio. Explicit.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 63 lines, in arts 1–2 with blocks of text and comment alternating, the text in larger script on every second line.

handDesc.handNote: Written in a small neat English or French early gothic bookhand.

decoDesc.decoNote: A blue and red flourished initial; blue initials, plain or flourished in red; red paraphs.

origin.origPlace: script of English or French appearance.

msItem.author: JOHN OF DAMASCUS
msItem.title: De Fide Orthodoxa
msItem.rubric: Iohannis presbiteri Damasceni qui Mansur liber incipit in quo est traditio certa orthodoxe fidei capitulis diuisa a Burgundione iudice ciue Pisano de greco in latinum ...
msItem.explicit: ab ipso est gaudium fructificantes amen.
msItem.note: Ed. E. M. Buytaert (St Bonaventure, NY, 1955).

msItem.author: PROSPER OF AQUITAINE
msItem.title: De Vera Innocentia ex Operibus S. Augustini (or Liber Sententiarum)
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber beati Augustini de uera innocencia.
msItem.incipit: Innocentia est uera quem nec sibi nec alteri nocet
msItem.explicit: aliquando memor autem eris si teipsum respexeris.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber Augustini de uera innocencia uel Prosperi sentencie collecte ab Augustinus. Explicit quod idem est liber.
msItem.note: The running head is Liber Prosperi extracte a libris Augustini. CPL 525; CCSL 68A (1972), pp. 257–365.

msItem.author: RICHARD OF ST VICTOR
msItem.title: De Potestate Ligandi et Soluendi
msItem.rubric: (Ricardi de sancti Victore liber de potestate ligandi et soluendi in a later hand.)
msItem.incipit: Quodcumque ligaueris super terram ...; Queritis a me utrum hoc ligandi atque soluendi potestas
msItem.explicit: beatus uir cui non imputauit Dominus peccatum.
msItem.note: Ed. J. Ribaillier, Richard de Saint-Victor. Opuscules théologiques (Paris, 1967), pp. 77–110; Stegmüller, Bibl. 7340.

msItem.author: RICHARD OF ST VICTOR
msItem.title: De Spiritu Blasphemiae
msItem.rubric: (Ricardus de Sancto Victore. Liber de spiritu blasphemie in a later hand.)
msItem.incipit: Que in euuangelio leguntur de spiritu blasphemie obscura ut dicis et perplexa sunt ualde
msItem.explicit: si insipiens factus sum tu me coegisti.

msItem.author: RICHARD OF ST VICTOR
msItem.title: De Iudiciaria Potestate in Finali et Vniuersali Iudicio
msItem.rubric: (Ricardus de Victore in librum de potestate iudiciaria in a later hand.)
msItem.incipit: In regeneratione cum sederit filius hominis in sede maiestatis sue ...; Ecce audiuimus quid ueritas ipsa apostolicis uiris promittat

msItem.author: THOMAS AQUINAS
msItem.title: Expositio in Symbolum Apostolorum
msItem.rubric: (Thomas de expositione cimboli in a later hand.)
msItem.incipit: Credo in unum Deum. Primum quod est necessarium Christiano cuilibet
msItem.note: Ed. R. M. Spiazzi, S. Thomae Aquinatis opuscula theologica (Rome 1954), pp. 193–217; Glorieux, Rép.. 14da.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 39 lines; running heads between separately-ruled lines.

handDesc.handNote: Written in an English gothic rotunda bookhand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Arts 4–5 blue or red initials, plain, or highlighted or modestly flourished in the other colour; red titles and running heads; arts 6–9 brick-red initials, underlining and highlighting.

msItem.author: RICHARD OF ST VICTOR
msItem.title: De Trinitate
msItem.incipit: Iustus meus ex fide uiuit. Apostolica sententia est simul et prophetica
msItem.explicit: quomodo conueniat unitas scribere cum personarum pluralitate.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 43–9 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Written in a hand similar to I, but definitely French.

decoDesc.decoNote: A blue initial flourished in red; red initials and titles.

msItem.author: RICHARD OF ST VICTOR
msItem.title: Liber Exceptionum
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt allegorie v. librorum Moysi de ueteri testamento.
msItem.incipit: In precedentibus premissa descriptione originis uel discretionis artium
msItem.explicit: usque ad obitum Herodis multique consilii spiritum accipiunt.
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt allegorie v. librorum Moysi cum descriptione quatuor euangeliorum. Adsit ei lumen qui scripsit tale uolumen.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 51 lines.

decoDesc.decoNote: The same brick-red initials, underlining and highlighting as part II.

msItem.author: NICHOLAS TREVET OP
msItem.title: Expositio Historiarum que tanguntur ab Augustino in libro de Civitate Dei
msItem.incipit: Gloriosa dicta sunt de te ciuitas Dei Ps. lxxxvi. Cum Romani aliquando Gothorum irrupcione affligentur
Ad intellectum eorum que dicuntur in primo capitulo tria sunt notanda
msItem.explicit: conuenerit cum uerba fide resurrectionis future ad eternam beatitudinem ad quam nos perductam qui ...
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt abreuiaciones de ciuitate Dei secundum ignotum.
msItem.note: Largely unpr., but the commentary on x. 29-xxii. 30 was used to continue the commentary by Thomas of Wales, never completed by its author, in the printed edns. of that work; Kaeppeli 3136; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 397.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with fine pencil in 2 cols of 62 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Written in a hand similar to part II (Englsih gothic rotunda bookhand).

decoDesc.decoNote: Red and blue flourished initials; blue initials flourished in red, red or blue paraphs and running heads.
